<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions in all loops using the SCEV analysis functionality. This pass is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only used for testing purposes: if your pass needs delinearization, please</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use the on-demand SCEVAddRecExpr::delinearize() function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Compute the array dimensions Sizes from the set of Terms extracted from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the memory access function of this SCEVAddRecExpr (second step of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="comment">/// delinearization).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a174350306649bc16f97803763bcae8f7">findArrayDimensions</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal">                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Terms,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal">                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal">                         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ElementSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Collect parametric terms occurring in step expressions (first step of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// delinearization).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a15de929cad74fd49804c28fe22c149a9">collectParametricTerms</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Expr,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal">                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Terms);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return in Subscripts the access functions for each dimension in Sizes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (third step of delinearization).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a62f4b8744e4b75d5371fb9a8a471ca26">computeAccessFunctions</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Expr,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal">                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal">                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Split this SCEVAddRecExpr into two vectors of SCEVs representing the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// subscripts and sizes of an array access.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The delinearization is a 3 step process: the first two steps compute the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">/// sizes of each subscript and the third step computes the access functions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for the delinearized array:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1 Find the terms in the step functions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2 Compute the array size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3 Compute the access function: divide the SCEV by the array size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">///    starting with the innermost dimensions found in step 2 The Quotient</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">///    is the SCEV to be divided in the next step of the recursion. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">///    Remainder is the subscript of the innermost dimension. Loop over all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">///    array dimensions computed in step 2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// To compute a uniform array size for several memory accesses to the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">/// object, one can collect in step 1 all the step terms for all the memory</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">/// accesses, and compute in step 2 a unique array shape. This guarantees</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// that the array shape will be the same across all memory accesses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// FIXME: We could derive the result of steps 1 and 2 from a description of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the array shape given in metadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A&#91;&#93;&#91;n&#93;&#91;m&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for i</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">///   for j</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">///     for k</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">///       A&#91;j+k&#93;&#91;2i&#93;&#91;5i&#93; =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The initial SCEV:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A&#91;&#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#42;m+5&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;k&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1 Find the different terms in the step functions:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">/// -&gt; &#91;2&#42;m, 5, n&#42;m, n&#42;m&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2 Compute the array size: sort and unique them</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// -&gt; &#91;n&#42;m, 2&#42;m, 5&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// find the GCD of all the terms = 1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">/// divide by the GCD and erase constant terms</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">/// -&gt; &#91;n&#42;m, 2&#42;m&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">/// GCD = m</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">/// divide by GCD -&gt; &#91;n, 2&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">/// remove constant terms</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">/// -&gt; &#91;n&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// size of the array is A&#91;unknown&#93;&#91;n&#93;&#91;m&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3 Compute the access function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a. Divide &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#42;m+5&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;k by the innermost size m</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Quotient: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#125;&#95;k</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Remainder: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,5&#125;&#95;i, +, 0&#125;&#95;j, +, 0&#125;&#95;k</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The remainder is the subscript of the innermost array dimension: &#91;5i&#93;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">/// b. Divide Quotient: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#125;&#95;k by next outer size n</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Quotient: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,0&#125;&#95;i, +, 1&#125;&#95;j, +, 1&#125;&#95;k</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Remainder: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#125;&#95;i, +, 0&#125;&#95;j, +, 0&#125;&#95;k</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The Remainder is the subscript of the next array dimension: &#91;2i&#93;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The subscript of the outermost dimension is the Quotient: &#91;j+k&#93;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Overall, we have: A&#91;&#93;&#91;n&#93;&#91;m&#93;, and the access function: A&#91;j+k&#93;&#91;2i&#93;&#91;5i&#93;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abc378caf5071493fe3b2b98bf224be7c">delinearize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Expr,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ElementSize);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Gathers the individual index expressions from a GEP instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function optimistically assumes the GEP references into a fixed size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">/// array. If this is actually true, this function returns a list of array</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">/// subscript expressions in \\p Subscripts and a list of integers describing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the size of the individual array dimensions in \\p Sizes. Both lists have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">/// either equal length or the size list is one element shorter in case there</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is no known size available for the outermost array dimension. Returns true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">/// if successful and false otherwise.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8287f8eaeb936bb75dc1bb6ef39fbdd1">getIndexExpressionsFromGEP</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">                                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;int&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Implementation of fixed size array delinearization. Try to delinearize</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">/// access function for a fixed size multi-dimensional array, by deriving</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">/// subscripts from GEP instructions. Returns true upon success and false</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">/// otherwise. \\p Inst is the load/store instruction whose pointer operand is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the one we want to delinearize. \\p AccessFn is its corresponding SCEV</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">/// expression w.r.t. the surrounding loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab73239c9eac42ae767c00ecc64e98dff">tryDelinearizeFixedSizeImpl</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42;SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Inst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;AccessFn,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;int&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes);</Highlight></CodeLine>
